meanings.definition: To dismiss from a position or job, especially in the military.
meanings.sent1: The general cashiered the soldier for disobeying orders.
meanings.sent2: The company cashiered the manager due to financial irregularities.
meanings.sent3: The sergeant cashiered the recruit for wearing mismatched socks.
meanings.sent4: The captain cashiered the troublemaker, sending a clear message to the rest of the troops.
meanings.sent5: The president cashiered the corrupt official, setting a precedent for accountability.

meanings.definition: To remove someone from a position of authority or responsibility.
meanings.sent1: The principal cashiered the student council president for breaking school rules.
meanings.sent2: The board cashiered the CEO after a series of poor decisions.
meanings.sent3: The coach cashiered the team captain for missing practice.
meanings.sent4: The judge cashiered the mayor, bringing an end to the corruption scandal.
meanings.sent5: The supervisor cashiered the negligent employee, ensuring better performance in the team.

meanings.definition: To officially remove someone from a position or job.
meanings.sent1: The committee cashiered the treasurer for embezzlement.
meanings.sent2: The government cashiered the minister for misconduct.
meanings.sent3: The school cashiered the teacher for inappropriate behavior.
meanings.sent4: The organization cashiered the director for failing to meet targets.
meanings.sent5: The manager cashiered the receptionist, leading to improved customer service.
